summary: With over 10 years in business and management, I have built quite valuable experiences in managing resources, entrepreneurship, business and branding development and program management. Efficiency, innovation, sustainability, customer satisfaction and impact are key factors that I thrive to achieve at work and life.

projects.title: Mission Without Borders
projects.description: Implementing Salesforce for all its 12 affiliate countries. The platform is vital as it offers a centralized platform for data management, fundraising, program oversight, volunteer coordination, and donor engagement. With multi-language and multi-currency support, Salesforce ensures flexibility and adaptability to diverse regions. The system's reporting, automation, and customization features enhance efficiency and effectiveness across affiliates, fostering global collaboration and compliance. This comprehensive tool empowers our clients to streamline operations, improve transparency, and make a more significant impact on their mission-driven initiatives worldwide.

contributors.headline: Senior Salesforce Consultant & Partner at Xebia | Lead fundraising team

projects.title: Mensen met een Messie
projects.description: Implementing Salesforce for nonprofits, to orchestrating a transformative shift in the organization's operations. This cutting-edge platform empowers MmeM with advanced analytics, automation, and donor management tools, enhancing their ability to drive social change efficiently. With Salesforce's nonprofit edition, MmeM is poised to amplify their mission-driven impact.

contributors.headline: Business Development Strategist @ Xebia - Salesforce.org | Program Manager Whiteflag Foundation | Co-founder of Africolt

projects.title: Fonds Kind en Handicap
projects.description: Implementing FinDock payment management platform for fundraising endeavors to operate efficiently, maintain transparency, optimize fundraising strategies, reduce costs, ensure compliance, and build and nurture donor relationships. These benefits collectively contribute to the organization's ability to fulfill its mission and positively impact the lives of those it serves. With FinDock for Salesforce, Fonds Kind en Handicap extends Salesforce to provide a complete end-to-end payment solution. It allows all types of donors to accept payments, process refunds, and manage their payment data all within Salesforce.

contributors.headline: Senior Salesforce Consultant & Partner at Xebia | Lead fundraising team

projects.title: High Carbon Stock Approach
projects.description: Creating a robust data model to support the operational framework of three distinct programs and executing the seamless integration of Salesforce. The integration with AMP Impact by Vera Solutions takes HCSA to another level, by automating processes and enhancing quality while managing its members' M&E, membership and applications processes.

projects.title: Catalyst 2030
projects.description: With its expansive network of 23 regional and country chapters, effective communication and collaboration are paramount for Catalyst 2030. The digital transformation via adopting world leading CRM (Salesforce) fosters collaboration, optimizing data-driven decision-making, and strengthening donor relationships to collectively advance their mission of achieving the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

projects.title: World Press Photos
projects.description: With its unique business model, a state-of-the-art CRM solution was essential for World Press Photo to effectively manage donors, supporters and the globally dispersed stakeholders relationships, centralize data, target fundraising efforts, improve donor retention, analyze fundraising performance, streamline event and membership management, and efficiently manage grant opportunities. These advantages were attained through meticulous configurations of the Salesforce platform and the integrations of some of our Xebia Salesforce custom solutions. The combined results significantly enhance World Press Photo's capacity to fulfill its mission and advance the cause of visual journalism and storytelling on a global scale.

projects.title: Handicart
projects.description: Implementing FinDock financial solutions is crucial for Handicart to manage its finances effectively, maintain memberships, build and nurture donor relationships, manage grants, control expenses, gain valuable insights from financial data, ensure compliance, and support scalability. These benefits collectively contribute to Handicart's ability to achieve its mission and create a positive impact for individuals with disabilities.

projects.title: Empowering the Women’s National Committee
projects.description: Generously funded by Dutch Gov. via Nuffic, in partnership with Maastricht School of Management and Royal Tropical Institute, the Netherlands

projects.title: Establishment of Aden Office - Non-Profit Management Unit
projects.description: Generously funded by USAID, in partnership with Counterpart International.

projects.title: CSOs Institutional Strengthening
projects.description:
Funded by USAID, USA
In partnership with Counterpart International
In this project, over 98 civil society organizations from over 14 governorates received institutional capacity development trainings and coaching. The project lasted for two years with budget over 450,000 USD

projects.title: Corporate Governance Development
projects.description:
Funded by International Finance Corporation (IFC), World Bank
Tens of well-established businesses in Yemen received Corporate Governance Training and Coaching. Beneficiaries were middle managers and CEOs of trading companies, banks, service firms, telecommunication corporations and oil and gas companies. The project lasted for over three years.

projects.title: Establishing Training and Consultancy Departments
projects.description: To foster economy of scope within the center where valuable intellectuality can be used, CBA established Training and Consultancy Unit to cater for businesses facing globalization and increased challenges.

projects.title: Establishing Non-Profit Management Unit
projects.description: Generously funded by USAID, in partnership with Counterpart International, this was the first and only Non-Profit Management Institute in Yemen. After the establishment, the program succeeded in training over 100 local NGOs in almost all governorates. The program covers the following topics: Nonprofit Management Concepts, Components, and History, Strategic Management, Good Governance, Monitoring and Evaluation ,Financial Management, Communication and Outreach, Gender Mainstreaming, Organizational and Quality Management, Volunteers and Human Resources Management, Advocacy, Project Management, Fundraising, Public Administration, Social Accountability, Networking, Proposal Writing

profile_positions.description:
Xebia is a pioneering IT consultancy company, following 1 mission, 4 values, and 4 business principles.

We design digital customer experiences and products. We build new IT and data infrastructures, introduce modern processes, and challenge teams to work (together) in a different way. We provide all skills and knowledge required to transform your business.

# Digital Strategy
# DevOps and SRE
# Agile Transformation
# Cloud
# Data and AI
# Software Technology
# Low Code
# Microsoft Solutions
# Xebia Academy

Xebia is a worldwide, innovative IT Consultancy Company, operating on a global scale with offices in the United States, Germany, India, the Netherlands, Belgium, Denmark, Dubai, the United Kingdom, Poland, Spain, Switzerland, Canada, Mexico, Vietnam, Singapore, Australia and Colombia.
profile_positions.title: Salesforce Consultant

profile_positions.description: CBA has thrived to offer high quality services through wide range of business programs such as Master of Business Administration (MBA), Corporate Governance, Business Training and Consultancy, and Not-for-profit Organization Management. With its international partnerships, CBA offers the only internationally accredited programs in the country and, therefore, the most sought-after destination for businesspeople.
profile_positions.title: Business Development Manager

profile_positions.description:
1. The MBA programs did not only become the first and only internationally accredited MBA program in Yemen, but also received triple accreditations. Their high-quality business education and services made them the best sought-after destinations by businesses and corporations in relatively short time.
2. Non-Profit Management Unit; the first and only Non-Profit Management Institute in Yemen. After the establishment, the program succeeded in training over 100 local NGOs in almost all governorates. 
3. Training and Consultancy Unit. 
4. Corporate Governance Program.
profile_positions.title: Programs/Projects Development Manager

volunteer_experiences.description: I've joined Yemen2Be to help Yemen (the largest humanitarian crisis in this decade) by providing free training to talented Yemeni individuals around the globe. We also help them with their employability skills to meet the demand of local markets. We made a great impact so far and many landed their dream jobs in the Salesforce ecosystem and became able to provide financial help to their families in Yemen to mitigate the burden caused by the ongoing war.
Fundraising Structures, Marketing Plans and Business Development

Planning and business models, need analysis and ideas proofing, financial projections, sustainability and risk mitigation, enlarging stakeholders network, internal communication, fundraising methods and techniques

Guided and motivated the entire team (+150) to work in alignment with the requirements of the international accreditation agencies in order for the institute to be internationally accredited. Main interventions were: Analyzing, Planning, Staffing, Coordinating, Motivating, Controlling, Coaching, Advising
